17de8f6ab254cc7e.title: Sr Director, Product Management - Data Platform & Developer Experience
17de8f6ab254cc7e.desc:
As a leader, you will reinvent the data product strategy for Anywhere. Building the strategy and vision for the back-end behind Anywhere’s products as well as leading the execution of our data platform products. Our mission is to unlock the power of Anywhere’s data – with the exciting challenge of leading a team responsible for developing and maintaining scalable, reliable and secure data platform solutions and enabling product teams to build the next generation of data driven innovations for our agents, brokers and consumers. 
  
   Mission:  
 
 
 
    Can you wake up each morning obsessed with how to design, build and lead the best data platform for data consumers? 
    
 
 
    Own the big picture across the product ecosystem, serving as a key leader responsible for connecting the dots across architecture, product, engineering and data. Establish the vision for a world class data platform and developer experience. 
    
 
 
    The role will balance incremental product enhancements with larger entrepreneurial opportunities! Ensure scalability, reliability and security of data platform solutions 
    
 
 
    Establish consistent metrics and qualities that each data product should encompass including: reliability, observability, scalability, extensibility, usability, security and compliance, and roadmap. 
    
 
 
    Deliver increased data accessibility (surface data where people need it, when they need it), increased data democratization (make it easier for people to manipulate the data), faster return on investment on data (quicker insights), time savings for the team and consumers, and more precise insights. 
    
 
 
    Play a critical role in collecting, cleansing, and applying data to derive valuable business insights. 
    
 
 
    Looking across products to build centralized solutions, modernize, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. 
    
 
 
    In collaboration with data and engineering, own data democratization and increasing the time to value for the data itself. Working closely with data consumers, building a clear roadmap for all aspects of the data product team. 
    
 
 
    Establish end-to-end data management solutions, infrastructure and foundations for Anywhere products. Serve as a key leader in ongoing data governance. 
    
 
 
    Create an ecosystem of products and solutions that lets developers focus on their business logic without worrying about the underlying infrastructure. 
    
 
 
    Establish direct and indirect value with APIs, figuring out a monetization strategy. 
    
 
 
    Drive prioritization of projects and overall vision to develop the organization’s internal capacity to optimally operationalize data. 
    
 
 
 Responsibilities  include, but are not limited to, the following. Other duties may be assigned. 
  
 
 
 
    Technical background in data with a strong product sense and excellent interpersonal skills to define, explain and implement your vision. 
    
 
 
    Possess exceptional leadership skills, motivating those building solutions with a deep understanding of the why and the what, inspiring their ownership of the how. 
    
 
 
    You are a data enthusiast! who has a deep understanding of data engineering, data science and analytics. Created and implemented a vision for a data platform that supports a variety of use cases and data consumers. 
    
 
 
    You naturally seek to validate your hypotheses with data and have experience setting quantifiable goals to measure progress. 
    
 
 
    Ability to work with engineers, have the statistical competence to collaborate with data scientists and translate the implications of that work to less technical partners, and the business sense to drive product. 
    
 
 
    Build partnerships with other product managers across the organization. Collaborative approach working with cross-functional engineering, design, and marketing teams 
    
 
 
    Serve as a product leader and executor who can create and deliver against and influence the roadmap and strategy for the data platform and developer experience team across the different product areas at Anywhere, balancing short- and long-term priorities against various business needs. 
    
 
 Requirements  
 
 
 
    10+years of proven experience in data and product management leadership; best suited for a product leader who is passionate about technology and working with developers 
    
 
 
    Experience building, deploying, running and driving adoption of API-based products and services 
    
 
 
    Understanding of API-related concepts including JSON, REST, GRPC, GraphQL and API tools such as Postman and Swagger/OpenAI Spec 
    
 
 
    Experience launching critically important data platforms, products and capabilities at SaaS companies and as an agile engineering team member 
    
 
 
    Building, mentoring and leading impactful product teams with empathy and customer first attitude 
    
 
 
    Experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning and API monetization is a bonus 
    
 
 
    Ability to define API vision, end-to-end consumer experience for API products including adoption incentives, post-adoption metrics 
    
 
 
    Proficient in agile product management methodology and tools 
    
 
  #LI-DH2   #LI-Remote   
 
 
 Exciting News:  
 
 
 EEO Statement:  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability 
  
 
 Compensation Range:  
 
  $160,000 - $230,000; At Anywhere, actual compensation within that range will be dependent upon the individual’s skills, experience, and qualifications.

7681931c6a167537.title: Recruiter - Contract
7681931c6a167537.desc:
Our Purpose 
 
 
   At Fiddler, we understand the implications of AI and the impact that it has on human lives. Our company was born with the mission of building trust into AI. With the rise of the internet, trust in AI has been degraded by a plethora of issues like spam, fraudulent transactions, hate speech, and online abuse. Fiddler enables organizations to get ahead of these issues by building trustworthy, transparent, and explainable AI solutions.
  
 
 
  Fiddler partners with AI-first organizations to help build a long-term framework for responsible AI practices, which, in turn, builds trust with their user base. Data Science, MLOps, and business teams use Fiddler AI to monitor, explain, analyze, and improve their AI solutions to identify performance gaps, mitigate bias, and drive better outcomes. Our platform enables engineering teams and business stakeholders alike to understand the “why” and how behind model outcomes.
  
 
 
  Our Founders 
 
 
   Fiddler AI is founded by Krishna Gade (engineering leadership at Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, Microsoft) and Amit Paka (two-time founder with acquisitions by Samsung and PayPal and product roles at Expedia and Microsoft). We are backed by Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Lux Capital.
  
 
 
  Why Join Us 
 
 
   Our team is motivated to unlock the AI opaque box and help society harness the power of AI. Joining us means you get to make an impact by helping reduce algorithmic bias and ensure that models in production across many different industries are transparent and ethical. We are an early stage startup, and have a rapidly growing team of intelligent and empathetic doers, thinkers, creators, builders, and everyone in between. Within Fiddler, there is ample opportunity for growth. The AI and ML industry has a rapid pace of innovation and the learning opportunities here are monumental. This is your chance to be a trailblazer.
  
 
 
  Fiddler is recognized as a pioneer in the field of Model Performance Management (MPM) and has received numerous accolades, including: 2022 a16z Data50 list, 2021 CB Insights AI 100 most promising startups, 2020 WEF Technology Pioneer, 2020 Forbes AI 50 most promising startups of 2020, and a 2019 Gartner Cool Vendor in Enterprise AI Governance and Ethical Response. 
  
 
  By joining our brilliant (at least we think so) team, you will help pave the way in the MPM space.
  
 
 
  This Recruiter will have complete ownership over Engineering Recruiting in Fiddler's US HQ and should be excited to spearhead Recruiting efforts for a tight-knit, very talented team. 
  
 What You'll Do  
 
 Source and recruit candidates across technical roles for the US 
  Develop trust-based relationships with candidates, and manage the end-to-end hiring process (sourcing through onboarding), providing a great candidate experience throughout 
  Ensure that Fiddler's talent brand and standards of process are maintained across multi-national teams 
  Work closely with hiring managers to constantly improve interview processes and candidate experience 
  Partner with hiring managers to thoroughly understand the needs of their teams and create effective strategies and sourcing campaigns to target ideal candidates 
  Act as a Fiddler knowledge base and point person for candidates 
  Find creative ways to reach out to new demographics of candidates 
 
  What We are Looking For 
 
  Bachelor's degree 
  Previous use of an ATS system (Lever, Greenhouse) 
  2 Years of experience 
  Experience with high-volume sourcing for Machine Learning Engineers, DevOps Engineers, Data Scientists, and other technical positions 
  Experience facilitating a great candidate experience from introduction call to decision to offer acceptance 
  Track record of building and cultivating strong candidate relationships 
  A successful track record closing candidates with a demonstrably high offer-to-acceptance ratio 
  Previous experience looking for enterprise-level talent 
  A sense of urgency and ability to work with people at every level of the organization 
  A willingness to take ownership over your role and drive constant improvement of our processes 
 
 
   Fiddler is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

f8979ea2d57941e5.title: Engagement Director
f8979ea2d57941e5.desc:
If you are a 
  Client Engagement Director with experience in the Data and Analytics  world, and you are looking for a high-impact role with a global leader in digital transformation, EPAM is the perfect next step in your career! As an EPAMer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a supportive team, on a variety of interesting projects for some of the biggest brands in the world. Are you ready for the next step in your career journey? Apply now!
  
  Req.#527984115
  
  RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  Build trusted partner relationships with senior client stakeholders 
  Provide thought leadership in the D&A space, help define the analytics agenda for your clients, and identify specific opportunities to create value with D&A 
  Drive client engagement, ensuring that projects “land successfully” and generate tangible business value 
  Align with Business teams & Senior Leadership to co-develop account plans and strategies for delivery, growth, and client satisfaction 
  Drive revenue within the client account portfolio by identifying, solutions, launching, and orchestrating a wide range of data & analytics engagements 
  Serve as a principal consultant leading complex transformational initiatives 
  Own and actively contribute to the strategic deliverables such as vision & mission statements, assessment solution visions, strategies, plans, and roadmaps 
  Support pre-sales activities by assessing digital opportunities, responding to RFPs, creating proposals, and helping to close new deals 
  Make a measurable impact on client value, support revenue growth, achieve target billable utilization, and be an active contributor to EPAM and your team 
 
  REQUIREMENTS
  
  Extensive experience in IT or Management Consulting (12+ years) 
  Proven history of launching and managing complex technology initiatives or large-scale programs while working with senior business & IT stakeholders 
  Demonstrated success in developing and growing client relationships 
  Strong problem-solving and creative thinking 
  Ability to operate at the strategic level, yet being close enough to the details to add value to clients and be a real support to your team 
  Experience with end-to-end data analytics project delivery (BigData, Cloud DWH, Advanced Analytics / MLOps) 
  Awareness of cloud/data technologies and trends with practical experience with one or more major data analytics technologies 
  Comfortable managing customer expectations & presenting solutions to senior stakeholders 
  Enjoys leading influential changes in business strategies 
  Ability to challenge and influence data solution design and technology selection for enterprise data platforms, warehouses, data lakes, and data science platforms 
  Desire to learn and expand your comfort zone 
  Expertise in at least one functional area: supply chain, sales & marketing, finance, manufacturing, retail, CPG, travel, hospitality, financial services, automotive, healthcare, and/or media & entertainment 
  Experience building data and analytics organizations by establishing a center of excellence, data engineering pools, and data science team (preferred) 
  Comfortable leading on-site customer workshops 
  Hands-on experience in pre-sales activities 
 
  BENEFITS
  
  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (Subsidized) 
  Health Savings Account 
  Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care, Commuter) 
  Short-Term and Long-Term Disability (Company Provided) 
  Life and AD&D Insurance (Company Provided) 
  Employee Assistance Program 
  Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions 
  Matched 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan 
  Paid Time Off – the employee will be eligible to accrue 15-25 paid days, depending on specific level and tenure with EPAM (accrual eligibility may change over time) 
  Paid Holidays - nine (9) total per year 
  Legal Plan and Identity Theft Protection 
  Accident Insurance 
  Employee Discounts 
  Pet Insurance 
  Employee Stock Purchase Program 
  If otherwise eligible, participation in the discretionary annual bonus program 
  If otherwise eligible and hired into a qualifying level, participation in the discretionary Long-Term Incentive (LTI) Program 
 
  ABOUT EPAM
  
  EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential 
 
  ADDITIONAL
  
  This posting includes a good faith range of the salary EPAM would reasonably expect to pay the selected candidate. The range provided reflects base salary only. Individual compensation offers within the range are based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to: geographic location, experience, credentials, education, training; the demand for the role; and overall business and labor market considerations. Most candidates are hired at a salary within the range disclosed. Salary range: $133k – $210k. In addition, the details highlighted in this job posting above are a general description of all other expected benefits and compensation for the position

dd5e69de78d588f2.title: Director of Quality Engineering
dd5e69de78d588f2.desc:
Director of Quality Engineering 
  Remote 
 
 USD$140,000 
 
 
  SMG (Service Management Group) is looking for a savvy Director of Quality Engineering. 
  As Director of Quality Engineering, you will be responsible for ensuring the overall quality of SMG’s platforms. Closely working with DevOps to integrate automated test suites into our CI/CD pipeline using existing and new tools to maintain 80% automated test coverage. Collaborate seamlessly with product management, engineering stakeholders and empower tech teams to deliver outstanding and impactful results. 
 
  ✅ Your day-to-day work : 
 
  Design and implement an end-to-end automation testing framework for SMG’s platforms. 
  Provide strategic guidance for all aspects of enterprise software testing. 
  Architect the Test Methodology, create the Quality KPI and take actions to drive the teams to deliver perfect quality enterprise products. 
  Collaborate with Product and Engineering to create and execute automated test plans for new and existing features that cover all requirements and anticipate engineering delivery. 
  Track testing progress and report quality metrics to stakeholders. 
  Proactively pinpoint opportunities to improve quality and devise solutions to achieve them. 
  Proactively address and solve cross-team issues, foster teamwork and collaborations. 
 
 
  ✅ Requirements : 
 
  7+ years of experience as a QA Automation Engineering Manager for web applications. 
  Developed and implemented strategic QA disciplines for SaaS companies. 
  In-depth knowledge of QA methodologies, tools, and best practices, including both manual and automated testing. 
  Strong understanding of software development processes, such as Agile or Scrum, and experience working in a continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) environment. 
  Expertise in various types of testing, such as functional, performance, security, and usability testing. 
  Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex issues and identify appropriate solutions. 
  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders. 
  A commitment to continuous improvement and staying current with industry trends and developments. 
  Extremely high standards for quality and take initiative to achieve them. 
  You thrive in a team setting and are excited to collaborate closely with Product, Design and Engineering. 
 
 
  ✅ You will be highly competent in : 
 
  JavaScript, HTML and CSS. 
  Microservices and monolithic architectures. 
  Document Object Model (DOM). 
  Industry standard testing frameworks and tools. 
  API and load automation testing. 
  Git or another source control. 
 
 
  ✅  Ideal Candidate Attributes : 
 
  Previous team leadership experience. 
  Recruitment, mentoring, and career development. 
  Experience with both greenfield development and supporting legacy platforms. 
  Worked with MLOps, data as a product, and building self-service capabilities. 
 
  ✅  What do we offer to you : 
 
  Fully remote, infinite contract, full-time position (4 hours of business working hours overlap with the US Central time zone) 
  Unlimited PTO. 
  14 weeks of parental leave. 
 
 
  Diverse, experienced, friendly team which will welcome, support and challenge you. 
  BYOD – reimburse up to $1500 if you opt to purchase a device (either Mac or Windows). 
  SMG is an equal opportunity employer, fostering an inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected, valued, and engaged. 
 
 
  ✅ About SMG 
  SMG inspires experiences that improve people’s lives. We are a catalyst for change—helping organizations generate new revenue, grow existing revenue, reduce churn and detractors, and drive operational efficiencies. Our unique software with a service (SwaS) model puts a dual focus on platform technology and professional services, making it easy for brands to activate insights based on customer, patient, and employee feedback. 
  Interested? Apply today!

e013c137af780e82.title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Colombia Remote
e013c137af780e82.desc:
Senior DevOps wanted! 
 
 
 
  IDT is looking for a professional who'll help our Engineering Team build and deploy code 
    better & faster  and help transition to a more Agile mindset using industry standards.
   
 
 
 
 In this role, you will: 
 
 
  Provide support to a product with multiple teams and about a hundred dev and QA engineers; 
  Maintain robust infrastructure in AWS using Infrastructure As A Code. Develop automation scripts and tools for system provisioning, configuration management, and deployment. 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand software development and deployment requirements, and provide technical guidance on infrastructure and DevOps best practices. 
  Identify and resolve infrastructure issues, including performance bottlenecks, network connectivity problems, and security vulnerabilities. 
  Ensure high availability and disaster recovery capabilities by implementing backup, failover, and recovery mechanisms. 
  Follow all best practices and procedures established by the company. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We would like you to have experience with this technologies: 
 
 
  At least 3 years experience with AWS; 
  2 years of experience with Jenkins; 
  Experience with Cloudformation; 
  Experience with CDK 
  At least 1 of experience with either Ansible(preferable) or Chef. 
  Good level of English – B2 or higher. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It would be good to have: 
 
 
  Experience with Terraform; 
  GitHub Actions is a strong plus; 
  Writing Jenkins Pipelines on Groovy; 
  Knowledge in networking engineering. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We are pleased to offer you: 
 
 
  An exciting and challenging job with talented people around. 
  Competitive salary and growth opportunities. 
  Really good hardware. 
  Remote work opportunity! 
  B2B Employment ($, gross) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   IDT is a multinational provider of cloud communications, PoS systems, unified communications, and financial services for businesses and consumers, headquartered in New Jersey. We are listed on the NYSE, employ 1300 people across 20+ countries, and have revenues over $1.5 billion.
   
 
 
  At IDT, we understand the challenge of being apart from those who matter most, so we create products that enable people to keep in touch and share resources worldwide.
   
 
 
  We are not ”another big IT corporation” – we encourage and support any in-house entrepreneurs to develop their ideas into business action.
   
 
 
  It seems like you are interested if you are here, so let’s chat! 
 
 
 
  Please submit your CV in English.

f5ac7aef19c33e33.title: DevOps Project Manager - REMOTE
f5ac7aef19c33e33.desc:
Overview 
  Are you looking to join a growing company where you can do the best work of your career? At Contegix we believe in a team environment that promotes the ability to make a difference within the organization. We treat our employees with the same commitment to "Go Beyond" in an environment of respect, collaboration, and dedication to excellence. 
  Contegix, an Atlassian Platinum Solutions Partner, specializes in delivering full stack solutions for everything surrounding Atlassian tools, from securing the platform they run on all the way up to the business processes that the tools enable. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service to our customers by leveraging our deep understanding of Atlassian solutions and our commitment to staying on the cutting edge of technology. 
  The  DevOps Project Manager  will be directly responsible for developing comprehensive project plans, tracking objectives, and ensuring the successful execution of security projects related to Kubernetes container environments. They will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, from security experts to engineers, track project scope, allocate resources, and establish timelines. Their responsibility includes overseeing the implementation of project objectives, monitoring progress, and ensuring that the tools needed to complete the objectives are available. This role will rely heavily on the ability to effectively coordinate and interact with various stakeholders on projects in a cross-functional manner. 
   
 Responsibilities:  
 
 Facilitate stand-up meetings, project planning meetings, project retrospective meetings etc.. 
  Develop and maintain issue logs. Maintain project repositories of documents. Prepare documents for various recurring meetings including minutes, issue logs etc.. 
  Develop presentation documentation as required for project teams. 
  Prepare project dashboards for various project meetings and committees. 
  Provide support in project financials, including monthly review of project charges, variance analysis, updating program forecasts and other tasks that may require analysis and reporting at project/program level. 
  Learn and utilize Jira plus reporting tools for the ongoing production and distribution of a comprehensive set of monthly, weekly and ad hoc project financial reporting to a variety of program stakeholders (including templates for use by other project members). 
  Tracks project commitments, communicates risk and risk mitigation strategies where appropriate. 
  Prepare project status reports and other project documentation as required. 
  Responsible for project-related details and ensure they are completed to client satisfaction levels. 
  Understand project deliverables and can speak to the business rationale as to why the team has prioritized one feature or deliverable over another. 
  Maintain documentation within the Contegix knowledge base to ensure that all departments have access to the latest information. 
  Develop and maintain project plans, project tasks and resource requirements. 
  Manage project budget, timelines, and resource allocations. 
  Providing World Class Customer Service (measured by NPS). 
  Building a Case Study and Reference Library. 
  Ensure P&L objectives are met. 
  Building a positive and engaged Consulting team. 
  Responsible for delivery of client services and support. 
  Perform other duties as assigned or required. 
 
   
 Requirements:  
 
 A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a Project Management position is required.  
 A university degree is considered an asset. 
  Hands-on Jira and Confluence experience is preferred.  
 Atlassian Professional Certifications (ACP) are a plus. 
  Expertise in maintaining a central repository of project plans, reports, competencies, etc. is required.  
 Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.). 
  Proactivity and flexibility in a fast-paced growing environment with shifting priorities and timelines. 
  Demonstrated discretion and confidence dealing with highly sensitive matters. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills; concurrent with writing meeting minutes. 
  Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills. 
  Ability to work on multiple concurrent tasks when required. 
  Strong aptitude for leadership, process implementation and problem solving. 
 
 
  Contegix professionals are committed to excellence. We strive to be experts in our chosen fields, and to be knowledgeable consultants who understand our clients’ needs and work creatively to leverage technology for their competitive advantage. Visit our website for additional information.  www.contegix.com . 
  Equal Opportunity Employer    Contegix participates in the E-Verify program. Therefore, any employment with Contegix will also be contingent upon confirmation from the Social Security Administration (“SSA”) and/or the Department of Homeland Security (“DHS”) of your authorization to work in the United States.

b66ffcaac83f57f1.title: DevOps Engineer
b66ffcaac83f57f1.desc:
Hybrid/Remote role 
  Multiple locations 
  Looking for a DevOps Engineer with prior experience with Big Data Solutions, Cloud technology, and strong working knowledge of Linux. Passionate about the concept of infrastructure as code and leverages modern tools to define, build and manage virtual infrastructure in the cloud. Work is performed in a hybrid environment with a great team. 
 
  Essential Job Responsibilities 
  The ideal candidate believes in exploring alternatives and quickly prototyping to validate hypothetical architectures or solutions.  
 Will significantly contribute to the development of custom software components and integration of open source code to address complex time series analysis problems through the use of cutting edge Big Data/ Cloud technology. Design, implement, and maintain core architecture and capabilities for software from prototype to operational applications.  
 Must understand software engineering fundamentals, OO programming, relational and time series databases, scripting knowledge and a basic level of development operations (DevOps) skill set.  
 Minimum Qualifications 
  Security Clearance - A current Secret is required and therefore all candidates must be a U.S. citizen.  
 5+ years of experience in DevOps Engineering or Software Development (Java preferred) and Bachelors in related field; or 3 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 9 years relevant experience. 
  Have a strong working knowledge of Linux systems, hosts, storage, networks, security, applications and proficiency in shell scripting (Shell/Bash, JavaScript, Python). 
  Excellent oral and written communication skills. 
  Must have a Security+ certification.  
 Must be able to work in a hybrid environment. 
  Preferred Requirements 
  Must have experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop and NoSQL Databases. Experience with AWS is highly desired. 
  Prior experience or familiarity with Unified Platform (UP) Big Data Platform (formerly owned by DISA) is a plus. 
  Data parsing/transforming techniques to include JSON, XML, CSV formats. 
  Understanding of AGILE software development methodologies and use of standard software development tool suites. (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Github Enterprise, etc.) 
  Willing to do on-call/pager duty is a big plus. Possible rotating shift in the future for this role as the current team is full.

feacaedc78bda70d.title: DevOps Engineer
feacaedc78bda70d.desc:
Company Overview 
  ActiveProspect is the industry-leading SaaS platform for consent-based marketing. 
  Our comprehensive product suite empowers companies across industries to take real-time action on their leads, protect themselves from litigation by documenting proof of consent, and save money by providing new levels of data insights and control. 
  Our mission is to make consent-based marketing the best channel for customer acquisition. 
  Job Summary 
  ActiveProspect is seeking a Development Operations Engineer to help operate and maintain our SaaS products. You’ll be working on our DevOps team to collaborate on developing and maintaining tooling to improve our infrastructure automation and deployments in the cloud. You’ll get the opportunity to use exciting technologies to build and optimize our platform that services millions of requests per second. 
  Responsibilities and Duties 
 
  Develop tooling to enable product development teams to build and deploy software as quickly and efficiently as possible 
  Partner with other engineers to identify the optimal cloud infrastructure, networking and storage design for each solution 
  Collaborate daily with fellow team members to drive best practices and identify innovative strategies for successful delivery 
  Assist in information compliance and security policies, SOC II testing, and remediation 
  Manage credentials and permissions, and ensure the security and health of our systems by monitoring and preventing vulnerabilities 
  Identify, recommend, and implement system improvements to reduce infrastructure costs 
  Participate in on-call rotation to ensure production’s system availability is 100% 
 
  Qualifications and Skills 
 
  Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field is required 
  3+ years experience operating large-scale customer-facing production environments with a focus on uptime and service quality 
  Deep proficiency working in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure, and/or GCP) 
  Strong knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Gruntwork) 
  Strong knowledge of Configuration Automation (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt) 
 
 
  ActiveProspect is an Equal Opportunity Employer

5f70e2c818b7724b.title: DevOps Specialist – R01528374
5f70e2c818b7724b.desc:
DevOps Specialist - R01528374 
 
 
 About Brillio:  
 
 
  Brillio is the partner of choice for many Fortune 1000 companies seeking to turn disruption into a competitive advantage through innovative digital adoption. Backed by Bain Capital, Brillio is one of the fastest growing digital technology service providers. We help clients harness the transformative potential of the four superpowers of technology - cloud computing, internet of things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), and mobility. Born digital in 2014, we apply Customer Experience Solutions, Data Analytics and AI, Digital Infrastructure and Security, and Platform and Product Engineering expertise to help clients quickly innovate for growth, create digital products, build service platforms, and drive smarter, data-driven performance. With delivery locations across United States, Romania, Canada, Mexico, and India, our growing global workforce of over 6,000 Brillians blends the latest technology and design thinking with digital fluency to solve complex business problems and drive competitive differentiation for our clients. Brillio was awarded ‘Great Place to Work’ in 2021 and 2022
  
 
 
  DevOps Specialist 
 
  Primary Skills 
 
  Adobe Creative Cloud, Cloud Health, Cloud Storage, Cloudcheckr, CloudForms, CloudHub/Mule, Cloudlets, Demandware / Commerce Cloud, Informatica & ETL Tools, Open Stack, Oracle Cloud Development (API, Data, Integration), PaaS - Oracle Integration Cloud, Powershell  
 
 Specialization 
 
  Cloud Platform consulting: Engineer, DevOps  
 
 Job requirements 
 
  Brillio LLC is a fast growing, pure play Digital Transformation Solutions and Services firm backed by Bain Capital private equity. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Silicon Valley, Brillio is focused on delivering design led solutions for our customers. We are not an IT Services company trying to pivot and support the “next big thing.” As a digitally native company, everything we have done and will continue to do, will have this laser focus. 
  Our culture is driven by Brillio’s Core Values and it is the foundation of who we are as an organization. We equip and empower our employees to push boundaries with an  ‘Entrepreneurial’  spirit as they craft  ‘Customer Success’  stories. With our customer-centric approach, we deliver  ‘Excellence’  at every level of our collaboration and this is what fuels Brillio’s growth story. While we are proud of our journey so far,  ‘We Care’  about our customers, employees and the community where we thrive in. We strive to stay committed to lighting up 100,000 young minds through our CSR efforts. 
  Role: DevOps Specialist- R01529874 
  Years of Experience: 8+ years 
  Location: Santa Clara, CA(Remote) 
  Your responsibilities in this role will include: 
 
 
 Implementation, upgradation and troubleshooting of Jenkins-pipeline, freestyle jobs, ansible-playbooks and OpenShift manifest files.  
 Apply the vulnerability remediation for web and app servers.  
 Fixing the build and deployment issues in various environments such as Dev, QA, UAT, Perf and Prod.  
 Continuously explore for opportunities to automate tasks to meet the availability OKR. DevOps Specialist – Skills  
 Bitbucket, Gitlab, Jenkins, Ansible, Openshift, Shell, Groovy, Flyway 
 
 
 
 Why should you apply for this role? 
  As Brillio continues to gain momentum as a trusted partner for our clients in their digital transformation journey, we strive to set new benchmarks for speed and value creation. The Advisory and Value Assurance (AVA) team at Brillio is at the forefront of leading this charge by reimagining and executing how we structure, sell and deliver our services to better serve our clients. 
 
 
 
 
  Know more about <add practice specific page link from Brillio website> 
  PPE: https://www.brillio.com/platform-and-product-engineering/ 
  Know what it’s like to work and grow at Brillio:https://www.brillio.com/join-us/ 
 
 
 
  Equal Employment Opportunity Declaration 
  Brillio is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, colour, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.

5ea199b300cb477b.title: Manager, DevOps
5ea199b300cb477b.desc:
It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way. 
  We are looking for a Manager, DevOps to join our Platform Engineering team reporting to the senior director of DevOps. In this role, you will work with a combination of Site Reliability engineers (SRE), DevOps engineers, and Application engineers to ensure the DevOps platform provides a uniform, reliable, and sustainable service medium for existing and new applications. You will use modern Agile practices to maximize team efficiency while incorporating feedback from Product Management, Support, Sales, and other internal stakeholders. 
  You are the ideal candidate if you enjoy pushing the boundaries of cloud automation, leading team members to create innovative DevOps solutions, and working with app teams to rapidly deliver solutions to customers. 
  What you’ll do: 
 
  Lead a team of 10-15 people comprised of DevOps engineers 
  Manage and mentor team members in growth opportunities with a lead-by-example approach 
  Deliver DevOps platform components within a larger release train comprised of fully automated CI/CD patterns 
  Coordinate with the Compliance team to ensure SOC2, FedRAMP, NISA 800-171, and ISO 27001 certifications are maintained  Collaborate with the Architecture team on projects using a combination of COTS and homegrown solutions 
  Recruit and grow the team as necessary, while fostering transparency, collaboration, and trust across geographically distributed areas 
  Drive innovation and continual improvement in both the technologies implemented and processes used to deliver them 
  Promote the pursuit of resilient and self-scaling systems that minimize customer impacts, while providing a healthy work environment for operators 
 
  What you’ll bring: 
 
  10+ years of software engineering experience 
  7+ years of software development management experience in Agile and/or DevOps environments 
  Hands-on experience with the full software development lifecycle for enterprise SaaS products 
  Hands-on experience with cloud architecture and deploying cloud infrastructure 
  Hands-on experience with AWS and Azure at scale, GCP preferred 
  Experience with compliance documentation, automation, and audits 
  Experience with CI/CD tools in a cloud environment such as GitHub, Kubernetes, KubeVela, Flux CD, etc. 
  Experience with infrastructure as code including Terraform or ARM 
  Preferred experience with monitoring and alerting tools including APM, Loki, PagerDuty, Prometheus, etc. 
  Preferred networking experience with TCP/IP, routing, and DNS 
  Bachelor’s Degree in CS, CE or EE or related field is required 
 
  What success looks like: 
  After six months, you will… 
 
  Understand Infoblox’s world-class DevOps operations 
  Create new ideas on activities in play 
  Improve an already high performing DevOps team and culture 
 
  After about a year, you will… 
 
  Collaborate with technical leaders across many development teams in the quest for engineering efficiency 
  Work with other leaders in the organization to further improve corporate processes 
  Serve as a leader and stakeholder for both short- and long-term DevOps initiatives 
 
  We’ve got you covered: 
  Our holistic  benefits  package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including a 401k with company match and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our  values  every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers. 
  Speaking of a great work environment, here are just a few of the perks you may enjoy, depending on your location… 
 
  Onsite massages, clubs, farmers market, and fitness classes 
  Delicious and healthy snacks and beverages 
  Electric vehicle charging stations 
  Outdoor amenities, seating, and courtyard BBQ 
  Dog park and pet-friendly programs 
  Newly remodeled offices with state-of-the-art amenities 
 
  Why Infoblox? 
  We’ve created a culture that embraces  diversity, equity, and inclusion  and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out  what it’s like to be a Bloxer .  We think you’ll be excited to join our team.      #LI-ME  #LI-Remote

c12c7dc52270d061.title: DevOps/IT Administrator (permanently remote)
c12c7dc52270d061.desc:
Salary: DOE / Competitive 
 Description 
 The Development Operations (DevOps) Assistant will assist with a wide array of tasks from setting up Server environments, monitoring production site uptime, helping with part or all of production deployments (based on experience gained over time), generating reporting (we utilize a BI tool called PowerBI), and some light troubleshooting. We have a growing team and are looking for driven individuals who are looking to grow and expand their career and opportunities. 
 Responsibilities 
 Starting out, the DevOps Assistant will help coordinate and deploy software on Windows Server 2022 & 2019 environments and will learn skills related to what is necessary for web application deployments into different environments. This will include items like direct software deployment to Azure cloud and making sure the environments and settings are meet or exceed the standards within our implementation process/guide. 
 This role will also monitor and maintain Windows updates across our virtualized servers and ensure items such as ransomware prevention software and machine level firewall settings are setup for maximum protection against threats. 
 Additionally, this role will take on some light reporting tasks which will be performed inside of a Microsoft SQL environment that has been integrated into Power BI and potentially help with pulling data from our Azure Dev Ops environment to create some reports for the management team. 
 A typical week for this individual will include monitoring our notifications for any site outages and reporting those to the Project Management and development team, working on standardizing our server reporting to make sure all required items are maintained and up to date. 
 Additionally, this role will have growth opportunities to learn how to debug and deploy our software to servers for clients, and eventually be able to handle internal development deployments to the team. In addition, we’re also conducting extensive efforts to containerize and fully leverage this process of containerization, deployment and automation. Similarly, we’re also heavily investing into AI and the associated infrastructure and deployment activities will be within this roles’ pervue as you ramp up and learn more. 
 As Clarity continues to grow over the next 12-18 months, we will have opportunities for this role to grow and become more specialized to include more general activities like AI, Containerization, Automated-Testing management, coordinating 4 and 5 levels of redundancy in backup and disaster recovery plans, and other items that will tie to the Development Operations Domain. 
 Requirements 
 Mandatory Skills: 
 Knowledge of Microsoft Server, Familiarity with Active Directory, understanding of computer hardware, exceptional communication skills, ability to type at 60 WPM or better, troubleshooting experience, base understanding of SQL queries 
 Preferred Skills: 
 A+ Certification, Network+ Certification, Familiarity with HTML/CSS, Familiarity with JavaScript or C based programming languages 
 Minimum Qualifications: 
 · Associates or Trade School Degree in a technology related field 
 · Experience installing Microsoft Operating Systems 
 · Understanding of basic Boolean logic 
 · Experience communicating directly with the team and potentially clients 
 Benefits 
 Health Insurance, 401(k), Profit Sharing Opportunities, Paid Time Off, Leadership Opportunities, Positive and Educational Work Environment, Ongoing Training, Client Facing Experience 
 Interview Process 
 Please - no faxes or phone calls. NO THIRD PARTY CONTRACTORS, RECRUITERS, CORP TO CORP OR CONSULTANTS. 
 The interview process will be thorough including an internal assignment. Apply only if you demand of yourself the same standards of excellence that you look for in your development team. 
 Please Note: We do not offer relocation at this time. We do not sponsor or transfer visas at this time. 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Pay: $35,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 
 401(k) matching 
 Dental insurance 
 Health insurance 
 Paid time off 
 Professional development assistance 
 Vision insurance 
 
 Compensation package: 
 
 Bonus opportunities 
 
 Schedule: 
 
 8 hour shift 
 Monday to Friday 
 Weekends as needed 
 
 Experience: 
 
 Network Management: 2 years (Preferred) 
 Active Directory: 1 year (Preferred) 
 Server Management: 2 years (Preferred) 
 
 Work Location: Remote

4c085212a5103e5b.title: Database Architect
4c085212a5103e5b.desc:
We’re in search of a Database Architect to build, tune and maintain the backbone of our production system. We’re looking for an RDBMS expert, with an appetite for applying best practices and optimizing our existing technologies, while also staying on top of the latest tools and technologies to help us grow and scale. You’ll be working on a small team, and your work will directly affect the success of our product. This position involves both maintaining a normalized and performant schema as well as performing standard database administrator duties. This person will meet regularly for development team architecture sessions, will audit developer-written SQL queries, and enhance the schema as needed to support new feature development. Database security, disaster recovery and load balancing are also key to this position.
  
 
  This is a 100% remote role, located within the US. We are unable to provide sponsorship for this position.
  
 
  About Us 
 
 
   Language I/O’s mission is to provide the most accurate and secure real-time translation solution for business. Our core translation product, CRM integrations, and API allow organizations to increase support capacity and expand to new markets, without requiring a proportionate expansion of their support headcount and contact center overhead. Our technology provides a robust translation service that aggregates and enhances outputs from the world’s top machine translation engines, embedded seamlessly into support agent workflows with our enterprise-grade integrations.
  
 
  Responsibilities 
 
 
 
 
     Optimize and tune data processing, data ingestion mechanisms, and data storage for performance and cost efficiency
    
 
 
     Transform operational data for Data Warehouse utilization
    
 
 
     Design and implement efficient data pipelines, ETL processes, and data integration workflows, automating repeatable tasks
    
 
 
     Install and maintain the performance of database servers and applications
    
 
 
     Develop processes for optimizing database security
    
 
 
     Recommend and implement emerging database technologies, staying up to date on advancements in machine learning and MLOps, and proposing solutions to enhance capabilities
    
 
 
     Set and maintain database standards
    
 
 
     Diagnose database errors, identify bottlenecks and optimize machine learning workflows for improved performance and efficiency
    
 
 
     Manage database access
    
 
 
     Create and maintain technical documentation, database reports, visualizations, and dashboards
    
 
 
     Be available for on-call support, on occasion, as needed
    
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
 
 
 
     Deep understanding of database architecture, data modeling, and data management, with a focus on Machine Learning and AI design and development
    
 
 
     Fluent in Boyce-Codd Normal Form
    
 
 
     Knowledge of the RDBMS core principles, including set up, tune, design, and newer unstructured data tools
    
 
 
     Deep experience using SQL and RDBMS technologies, such as MySQL, MS SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, AWS Aurora RDS and Domo BI and Analytics
    
 
 
     Experience working on database security, backup and disaster recovery, and performance monitoring standards
    
 
 
     Understanding of relational and dimensional data modeling, and experience with data transformation for machine learning
    
 
 
     Experience in AWS or other cloud environments
    
 
 
     Experience with Linux Server environments
    
 
 
     A knowledge of global regulations and best practices in data privacy
    
 
 
     Excellent communication skills
    
 
 
     Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
    
 
 
     A bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience
    
 
 
  Nice to haves 
 
 
 
 
     Experience with NoSQL databases frequently used in Machine Learning applications, such as Redis, Cassandra, CouchDB, and MongoDB
    
 
 
     Experience managing structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data across multiple sources and databases; including storage, normalization, transformation, retrieval, and mapping
    
 
 
  This is a 100% remote, full-time, salaried, exempt position. Qualified candidates must be authorized to work in the United States of America for any employer.
  
 
  Position includes medical, dental, and vision insurance plan options, 401(k), PTO, and a competitive salary.
  
 
  Job Type: Full-time, fully-remote
  
 
  Language I/O provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. 
 
 
  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

     Optimize and tune data processing, data ingestion mechanisms, and data storage for performance and cost efficiency
    
 
 
     Transform operational data for Data Warehouse utilization
    
 
 
     Design and implement efficient data pipelines, ETL processes, and data integration workflows, automating repeatable tasks
         
 
 
     Be available for on-call support, on occasion, as needed
    
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
 
 
 
     Deep understanding of database architecture, data modeling, and data management, with a focus on Machine Learning and AI design and development
    
 
 
     Fluent in Boyce-Codd Normal Form
    
 
 
     Knowledge of the RDBMS core principles, including set up, tune, design, and newer unstructured data tools
    
 
 
     Deep experience using SQL and RDBMS technologies, such as MySQL, MS SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, AWS Aurora RDS and Domo BI and Analytics
    
   
     Experience working on database security, backup and disaster recovery, and performance monitoring standards
    
 
 
     Understanding of relational and dimensional data modeling, and experience with data transformation for machine learning
    
 
 
     Experience in AWS or other cloud environments
    
 
 
     Experience with Linux Server environments
    
 
 
     A knowledge of global regulations and best practices in data privacy
    
 
 
     Excellent communication skills
    
 
 
     Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge

91cab04f45508d21.title: AWS DevOps Engineer III
91cab04f45508d21.desc:
Job Summary:  In this role you will be part of the team that architects, implements, and deploys our AWS cloud-based offerings. Specifically, we are looking for an engineer to work in the government space and on Infrastructure as Code. Clearance (application to be paid for by Rackspace) is required, and the successful applicant must reside in the US.
   
 
   
 
 
  Customer Focus:  Our DevOps Engineers get to build one-of-a-kind, cutting-edge cloud solutions for some of our top enterprise customers. Our primary focus is to instill confidence in our customers by creating customized solutions and a top-notch customer onboarding experience.
   
 
   
 
 
  Automation:  Customer deployments should be solidly reliable and repeatable. Knowledge of tools like Github, Terraform, and CDK are critical to achieving this goal. If you enjoy writing programmatic solutions to reduce customer turnaround time and your own workload, this team is for you.
   
 
 
 
  Work Location:  Remote
   
 
 
 
 Key Responsibilities:  
 
 
 Work with a talented and highly engaged team of Engineers, Relationship Managers and Product Team. 
  Automate deployments utilizing custom templates and modules for customer environments on AWS. 
  Architect Azure environment best practices and deployment methodologies. 
  Create automation tools and processes to improve Team and Racker day to day functions. 
  Educate customers on AWS and Rackspace best practices and architecture. 
  Assist in educational briefings for teammates to advance in technical trainings for continued growth. 
  Provide a continuous Fanatical Support experience for our customers. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications:  
 
 
 3+ years’ experience as a DevOps engineer. 
  Must be AWS Certified (3 cert minimum)  
 Near expert knowledge of AWS Products & Services, Caching, EBS, Scaling, Load Balancing, Networking etc. 
  Excellent working knowledge of Windows or Linux operating systems – experience of supporting and troubleshooting issues and performance. 
  Exceptional understanding of central networking concepts: VLANs, layer 2/3 routing, access lists & load balancing. 
  Near expert understanding of design of native Cloud applications, Cloud application design patterns and practices. 
  Highly skilled in Terraform/IaC, including CI/CD practices. 
  Knowledge of databases (SQL Server and MySQL. 
  Working knowledge of Backup and Recovery methodology and implementations. 
  Good knowledge of application development using Agile, and DevOps best practices. 
  Kubernetes exp. is a plus, as is exp. w/Relational and NoSQL Databases. 
 
 
  Discover your inner Racker:  
 Racker Life 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Government Investigation/Background Check:  
 
 
 This role will be supporting Government Customers and new hires will undergo an FBI Background investigation- Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS). 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   For applicants working in California, Colorado, Washington, or New York City, we are excited to share the base salary ranges for this position exclusive of fringe benefits or potential bonus. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. 
   
 
 The anticipated starting pay range of California, Washington state and New York City applicants for this role is $88,400 - $129,580. 
 The anticipated starting pay range of Colorado applicants for this role is $112,900 - $165,550. 
 
 
    Unless already included in the posted pay range and based on eligibility, the role may include variable compensation in the form of bonus commissions, or other discretionary payments. The discretionary payments are based on company and/or individual performance and may change at any time. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, licenses and certifications, and specific work location.
   
 
 
  About Rackspace Technology 
 
 
    We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.
   
 
 
 
 
 
  More on Rackspace Technology 
 
 
    Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

322d9db499a413ec.title: DevOps Engineer
322d9db499a413ec.desc:
Location
    
     Remote
    
 
 
 
     Salary
     
  $120,000 
  —  
 $120,000  
 
 
 
    Paid in BTC
    
 
 
 
 
 
     Exodus is looking for a DevOps Engineer who can support our business objectives by utilizing their rich Infrastructure as Code (IaC) experience with Terraform. As a department, we have prioritized refining our internal engineering efforts and this role will be essential in accomplishing this objective. Successful collaboration, proactively taking on initiatives, and tackling complex problems are personal values that will be highly appealing for this position. We’re excited to meet people with lofty ambitions (just like ours), please come join this foundational team at Exodus. 
    
 What You Will Do 
 
 Deploy and maintain infrastructure in AWS using Terraform & Terragrunt. 
 Enforce best practices among the team’s Infrastructure as Code (IaC) contributions, primarily in Terraform. 
 Spin up and maintain services in Kubernetes. 
 
 Who You Are 
 
 Familiar with AWS services such as EC2, RDS, S3, Lambda, VPC, IAM, and more. Experience setting up, configuring, and managing these resources. 
 Strong experience in writing, maintaining, and deploying infrastructure using Terraform. Ability to create reusable and modular Terraform scripts. 
 Proficient in deploying, managing, and scaling containerized applications using Kubernetes. This includes understanding of pods, deployments, services, and statefulsets. 
 Experience in setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines. 
 
 A Plus 
 
 Knowledge of security best practices, including configuring IAM roles and policies, secret management ( e.g., using AWS Secrets Manager ), and setting up secure Kubernetes configurations. 
 Understanding of VPC, subnets, NAT, NACLs, load balancers, and DNS. Ability to architect and troubleshoot network configurations. 
 Experience with maintaining & optimizing Postgres databases running on RDS/Aurora with TBs of data 
 
 About Exodus 
  Exodus is a multi-asset cryptocurrency wallet with a built-in exchange feature. We started our movement in 2015 and have been a distributed team since then. Our mission is to help half of the world exit the traditional financial system and move into the crypto financial system by the year 2030. To do that we want to make sure we hire the best of the best: people who are intrinsically motivated by what we are trying to achieve and who love what they do professionally.  
 What We Offer 
 
 Freedom to work wherever you want, whenever you want. 
 Building the future. Cryptocurrencies lay the foundation to the internet of value, the next major wave in application technology and personal finance. 
 Collaborative and feedback-driven culture. 
 Opportunity to grow.  
 Fair pay, no matter where you live along with a competitive benefits package. 
 100% pay in Bitcoin with a buffer to account for price changes and exchange fees.  
 All the tools you need to do the job  
 
 Benefits 
  Health : Most of our health insurance plans are covered 100% for you and covered 50% for your dependents. We’ll also cover dental insurance. If you are outside of the United States, we will reimburse you up to $500 per month for any medical and dental insurance for you and your dependents. 
  PTO:  30 days of paid time off per year on top of a flexible schedule where you can work  wherever  and  whenever . If you’re part-time with us, you’ll still receive 15 days of paid time off. 
  Unlimited Bereavement:  We will pay you your full salary for the first two weeks for the loss of any immediate family members but we allow you to take all the time you need to grieve outside of that. 
  Parental Leave:  13 weeks of fully paid leave with and a month of flexible work for the primary caregiver. 4 weeks of paid leave if you are the child's secondary caregiver. 
  Tax Help:  Getting paid in Bitcoin new to you? Don’t worry! We will reimburse you for speaking with a professional tax specialist in your state/country to make sure everything is taken care of. 
  Perks : Exodus offers a variety of seasonal perks such as coverage for gym memberships and therapy. We also offer quarterly Wellness Days! We want to make sure all of our employees know they are our priority and give back for your hard work often. 
  Our Hiring Process 
  To apply, we'd love to learn more about you. Please answer our application questions! Submitting a resume is optional. 
  Our hiring process consists of several different stages.  
 Recruiter Interview : If we like your initial application, expect to schedule an interview with a member of our recruitment team. This interview will focus on getting to know you a bit more and will focus on explaining the culture of the company. We want to know more about why you want to join our team, how you feel about our mission and cryptocurrency now and how it fits into your overall career plan to make sure this is the right place for you. 
  Assessments : Not every role consists of an assessment but if yours does it will be directly related to the job you apply for. 
  Interview with your future manager : This is to make sure that you are a fit for the role you are applying to and to explore your career history. In this interview, we’ll learn more about the hard and soft skills you possess to help determine if you’d be a good fit for us. 
  Interview(s) with your future colleagues : We call these focus interviews and they are a time for you to learn more about your role from someone you will closely collaborate with. It’s also a time for us to see how we align in terms of competencies and expected outcomes of the role. 
 
 
  Pay Transparency Notice:  Salary and all other total compensation information (bonus eligibility, benefits, and equity) will be discussed in detail during the hiring process. 
  Salary Range 
 
       $120,000—$120,000 USD

8ad403200e6bf3e8.title: DevOps Engineer
8ad403200e6bf3e8.desc:
Who We Are 
  Land Intelligence is a software technology company serving the commercial real estate industry. We focus on Land Development. We have been recognized as an industry technology leader in providing solutions on a national scale. Our team are visionaries that see a better, faster, and more valuable way to research, finance, and trade land.
  
 
 Our Culture 
  We are entrepreneurs first. Which means we manage the people, processes, and products. We create new ways of doing things to drive value. We are builders and growth minded. Our leadership team has been recognized as a Best Places to work in the industry nationally. Our team drives for personal and professional development, as personal growth is instrumental to our success. Your learning will be supported by specialized in-house training programs and mentoring by the industry’s leading experts, many of whom are our investors and strategic partners.
  
  We are a startup, but this isn't our first time doing this. As a result, you can get the thrill of working at a startup, with the resources of a publicly traded company. We offer a best-in-class benefits package, as we are a Professional Employment Organization (PEO) with our partner Insperity that includes medical, vision, dental and life insurance. Our 401 (k) program offers an employer match, along with a 401(k)-profit sharing and performance-based bonuses and generous paid time off.
  
 
 Your Impact at Land Intelligence 
  We are seeking a highly motivated, organized, and innovative DevOps Engineer to join our growing team. This critical role is responsible for working with software developers and system operators to ensure that the development and deployment of our flagship software platform, LandSUITE®, runs smoothly. We rely on this position to bridge the gap between the development and operations aspects of software development.
  
 
 Responsibilities 
 
  Collaborate with the software development and IT teams to understand the needs for system support in the development process.  
 Develop and implement strategies for continuous deployment to enhance the production environment.  
 Automate and streamline operations and processes to enhance speed and efficiency.  
 Design and implement tools for automated deployment and monitoring of multiple environments. 
  Troubleshoot and resolve issues in development, test, and production environments. 
  Manage the tools necessary to ensure automated testing and continuous integration.  
 Document processes and monitor system performance metrics. 
  Work with the software development and IT teams to identify and implement new technologies and update existing infrastructure.  
 
 Qualifications 
 
  Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role in software development and system administration.  
 Understanding of at least one of the following scripting languages: Python, Perl, Ruby, Bash. 
  Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and other containerization technologies. 
  Experience with CI/CD tools and version control tools (e.g., Git). 
  Proficiency in network, server, and application-status monitoring. 
  Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.  
 Experience with cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure) and infrastructure as code tools.  
 Familiarity with databases and SQL.  
 Ability to balance competing priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field – or equivalent work experience.  
 Land Intelligence is an EOE/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V. If you are interested in applying for employment and need special assistance to apply for a posted position, please send an e-mail to careers@landintelligence.net. Land Intelligence also participates in the federal E-Verify Program.

ba9fa1750ce80022.title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Costa Rica Remote
ba9fa1750ce80022.desc:
Senior DevOps wanted! 
 
 
 
  IDT is looking for a professional who'll help our Engineering Team build and deploy code 
    better & faster  and help transition to a more Agile mindset using industry standards.
   
 
 
 
 In this role, you will: 
 
 
  Provide support to a product with multiple teams and about a hundred dev and QA engineers; 
  Maintain robust infrastructure in AWS using Infrastructure As A Code. Develop automation scripts and tools for system provisioning, configuration management, and deployment. 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand software development and deployment requirements, and provide technical guidance on infrastructure and DevOps best practices. 
  Identify and resolve infrastructure issues, including performance bottlenecks, network connectivity problems, and security vulnerabilities. 
  Ensure high availability and disaster recovery capabilities by implementing backup, failover, and recovery mechanisms. 
  Follow all best practices and procedures established by the company. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We would like you to have experience with this technologies: 
 
 
  At least 3 years experience with AWS; 
  2 years of experience with Jenkins; 
  Experience with Cloudformation; 
  Experience with CDK 
  At least 1 of experience with either Ansible(preferable) or Chef. 
  Good level of English – B2 or higher. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It would be good to have: 
 
 
  Experience with Terraform; 
  GitHub Actions is a strong plus; 
  Writing Jenkins Pipelines on Groovy; 
  Knowledge in networking engineering. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We are pleased to offer you: 
 
 
  An exciting and challenging job with talented people around. 
  Competitive salary and growth opportunities. 
  Really good hardware. 
  Remote work opportunity! 
  B2B Employment ($, gross) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   IDT is a multinational provider of cloud communications, PoS systems, unified communications, and financial services for businesses and consumers, headquartered in New Jersey. We are listed on the NYSE, employ 1300 people across 20+ countries, and have revenues over $1.5 billion.
   
 
 
  At IDT, we understand the challenge of being apart from those who matter most, so we create products that enable people to keep in touch and share resources worldwide.
   
 
 
  We are not ”another big IT corporation” – we encourage and support any in-house entrepreneurs to develop their ideas into business action.
   
 
 
  It seems like you are interested if you are here, so let’s chat! 
 
 
 
  Please submit your CV in English.

92f5849f9972bab0.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
92f5849f9972bab0.desc:
Axoni is building the next generation of capital markets technology. Our solutions are used by the world’s leading banks, asset managers, hedge funds, and infrastructure providers. Our diverse team focuses every day on our goal of building products that will change and improve how our clients and the markets will interact.
   
 
 
  We are seeking talented, motivated professionals that want to be part of this once-in-a-career opportunity to not only see, but also drive the incredible changes coming to global capital markets. We are building a culture where our team feels valued and everyone is given an opportunity to grow and succeed. We try to live by our Core Values and demonstrate what we believe represent the kind of company we are working to build. These Values are: Delivery is everything; Choose Kindness; Be better every day.
   
 
 
  Axoni’s 
    Senior DevOps Engineering  members are responsible for the end to end management of all production and client facing infrastructure. You will be involved from the initial design phase of figuring out the right network topology for our clients to the final stages of deploying and setting up monitoring and alerting. The role requires good problem-solving skills and ability to work across several teams and clients. We’re looking for candidates who love to learn and are able to adapt quickly.
   
 
 
 
 You will:  
 
 
 Manage and configure all pre-production, production, and client facing infrastructure 
  Responsible for the provisioning and configuration of pre-production, and production resources 
  Responsible for monitoring and alerting strategy of all production and client facing infrastructure 
  Responsible for the creation of the steps and tools for software deployments to clients 
  Coordinate with the Applications team to satisfy all non-functional project requirements (security, performance, scalability, and resiliency) 
  Collaborate with the Platform Engineering team to build tools to help automate deployments 
  Coordinate with relevant teams to build useful tools to support network operations (internal and external) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 You have:  
 
 
 Experience with Docker (Docker compose, yamls, etc) 
  Experience with AWS and other cloud providers 
  Experience with container orchestrations tools (Kubernetes, ECS) 
  Experience using monitoring tools like Splunk, DataDog, Prometheus, Grafana 
  Experience troubleshooting issues on a remote distributed system 
  Experience with automation and configuration management tools (Terraform, Ansible, Salt, Chef, Puppet) 
  Experience with deploying and/or managing production systems and infrastructure 
  Strong communication skills and a collaborative team member 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   Individuals seeking employment at Axoni are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.

02bfc8c23396f550.title: DevOps Engineer
02bfc8c23396f550.desc:
Centennial Technologies is seeking a DevOps Engineer to work on a federal project. This position is fully remote. We can hire from DC, MD, VA, Oh, NC, MN, IL, and MS. 
 The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the following tasks: 
 
 Collecting contingency readiness plans for applications deployed in Platform as a Service (PAAS), primarily in AWS 
 Conducting a Contingency Plan of assets presently deployed in the 2189… Production AWS account in coordination with the Cloud Program and INTEGRATED Contingency Planning Team. 
 Contributing to and identifying gaps in the present contingency plan as a result of the exercise and recommending gap-fill solutions for future tests. 
 Communicating weekly via Jira project the status of the contingency plan review, test, and after-action with the IAB CP Team until the CP Test is accepted, including an after-action report (AAR). 
 Reviewing as-is architecture documentation for completeness and accuracy within the first thirty calendar days of the task. Identifying gaps in documentation using Jira and providing weekly updates of received documentation and outstanding documentation requirements. 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 
 Strong experience with AWS services, particularly in a production environment. 
 Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell. 
 Experience with configuration management tools like Ansible or Puppet. 
 Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins or GitLab. 
 Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. 
 Strong communication and collaboration skills. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 Collecting contingency readiness plans for applications deployed in the -BC accounts (2189… and 5867…). 
 Conducting a Contingency Plan of assets presently deployed in the 2189… Production AWS account in coordination with the Cloud Program and IAB Contingency Planning Team. 
 Contributing to and identifying gaps in the present contingency plan as a result of the exercise and recommending gap-fill solutions for future tests. 
 Communicating weekly via Jira the status of the contingency plan review, test, and after-action with the INTEGRATED CP Team until the CP Test is accepted, including an after-action report (AAR). 
 Reviewing as-is architecture documentation for completeness and accuracy within the first thirty calendar days of the task. Identifying gaps in documentation using Jira and providing weekly updates of received documentation and outstanding documentation requirements. 
 
 About the Company Centennial Technologies Inc. (Centennial) is committed to a healthy work-life balance for our employees and we have worked hard to foster an environment that enables employees to effectively prioritize both their professional and personal responsibilities. We make every effort to accommodate employees by providing flexible paid time off, a casual work atmosphere, frequent collaborative interaction, and the opportunity to continuously develop career skills. 
 Centennial offers a competitive benefit package, which includes Medical, Dental, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Life Insurance, 401k, Mass Transit Benefits, Paid Time Off and Federal Holidays. Our Culture is inclusive of: * A supportive professional environment which promotes a healthy work-life balance * Performance Management techniques which reward our top performers * Employee surveys and discussions to inform Management’s decisions * Paid training on the latest technologies and business practices * An employee-focused model * Our team’s shared vision of client success through cultivating long-term client relationships 
 Equal Opportunity Employer 
 Centennial is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local employment laws.
